articles.description: Saracens fly-half Owen Farrell remains "happy" with his decision to step away from England and is focusing on enjoying his rugby again.
articles.title: Farrell still 'happy' with England decision

articles.description: A court in Spain sentenced the former Brazil player to four and a half years in prison last month.
articles.title: Dani Alves: Ex-Brazil player to be freed on €1m bail after rape conviction

articles.description: Former Arsenal winger Paul Merson says football is "ravaged" with gambling and the bans given to Ivan Toney and Sandro Tonali are a "disgrace".
articles.title: Toney and Tonali gambling bans a disgrace - Merson

articles.description: Police search the headquarters of the Spanish Football Federation (RFEF) in Madrid as part of a corruption investigation.
articles.title: Spanish police search football HQ in corruption probe

articles.description: Wes Burns has withdrawn from Wales' squad for the forthcoming European Championship play-offs because of a hamstring injury.
articles.title: Burns ruled out of Wales' Euro play-offs

articles.description: Scouts from all 32 NFL teams will cast their eye over ex-Wales rugby star Louis Rees-Zammit at Wednesday's Pro Day in Florida.
articles.title: Louis Rees-Zammit: NFL scouts to watch ex-Wales rugby star at Pro Day

articles.description: England fast bowler Lauren Bell discusses withdrawing from the Women's Premier League, her ambitions for 2024 and her growing responsibility in Heather Knight's team.
articles.title: Why Bell put England before a £30,000 WPL deal

articles.description: Ferrari's Carlos Sainz is set to return for this weekend's Australian Grand Prix after recovering from surgery for appendicitis.
articles.title: Carlos Sainz: Ferrari driver set for Melbourne return after surgery

articles.description: From Europe's whipping boys to the Euro 2024 qualification play-offs, BBC Sport looks at Luxembourg's 'extraordinary' rise
articles.title: Luxembourg's 'extraordinary' rise to brink of history

articles.description: Paula Badosa says it will be "uncomfortable" playing "best friend" Aryna Sabalenka this week, following the death of Sabalenka's boyfriend.
articles.title: Aryna Sabalenka opponent Paula Badosa says match will be 'uncomfortable' after boyfriend's death
